entry.dcterms:title: SARTRE - Social Attitudes to Road Traffic Risk in Hungary 2010
entry.dcterms:creator: Hegedűs, Péter
entry.dcterms:subject: TÁRKI Joint Research Center TDATA-H48: SARTRE - Social Attitudes to Road Traffic Risk in Hungary 2010. data sheet. Version: 2011-05-02
entry.dcterms:creator: Gábor, Miklós
entry.dcterms:contributor: Institute for Transport Sciences Non Profit Ltd.
entry.dcterms:description: The aim of the survey is collect information about the attitudes towards the road safety among the three sub sample (car users, motorcyclists and other road users) of the Hungarian adult population
entry.dcterms:subject: transport, travel (and mobility)
person
survey data
cross-section
Multi-stage proportionately stratified national probability sample representative of the adult Hungarian population. Respondents were selected using the random walking method out of each strata.
face-to-face interview
entry.dcterms:rights: Publications based on TÁRKI data collections should acknowledge those sources, primary investigators and depositors.
entry.dcterms:subject: The english dataset doesn't contain labels
SPSS portable datafile
other study-related materials:
Hungarian 'car driver' questionnaire
Hungarian 'powered two wheeler' questionnaire
